news_header: Lithuanian Foreign Minister Kestutis Budrys, during his visit to Finland, warned that Russia could initiate a new wave of aggression by the end of the decade. He noted that while NATO's call for increased defense spending to 5% of GDP has not been well received in Europe, Lithuania plans to allocate 5-6% of its GDP for defense from 2026 to 2030.
news_original_title: Liettuan ulkoministeri: Maa nostaa asemenonsa Trumpin vaatimalle tasolle
news_text: Budrys emphasized the need for enhanced security measures due to increased Russian naval activity in the Baltic Sea and highlighted Lithuania's cautious approach towards China, advocating for awareness of economic dependencies.
